result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Torrey Jermaile Lee

records.addlTxt: All previously ordered conditions of bail remain.

Defendant Torrey Jermaile Lee in court.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference on 11-09-2022 at 01:30 PM, Branch 15.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
by attorney Wentz
Affidavit from defendant for request for equitable tolling in demand for trial.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Haley E Wentz in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a Calendar Call.  DEFENDANT FAILED TO APPEAR. 
Defense counsel has no explanation of defendant's non appearance. Court ordered Bench Warrant Issued. Remand to Commissioner  and No action on bail.

Attorney Haley E Wentz in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case calendared for a Status Conference. 
DEFENDANT FAILED TO APPEAR. Defense has no explanation for defendants non appearance and  request a calendar call date.  
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. This hearing will be in person.  Calendar call scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CASE ADJOURNED OFF THE RECORD.
Defense counsel is in trial in another court. New date confirmed with defense.
Case remains calendared in branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Defense Motion to Withdraw.

Defense counsel in court requesting to matter to scheduled at 1:30pm on 6-28-2022 at the request of her client.
Status Conference scheduled June 28, 2022 at 1:30pm.

Attorney Haley E Wentz in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Status Conference. Courrt waived defendant's appearance. 
Defense request an additional status date for reasons presented to the court. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  
  Status conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed.

Defendant Torrey Jermaile Lee in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for pretrial conference. 
Defendant appears without counsel and may qualify for a state public defender
Court instructed defendant to contact to the Public Defender Office to be evaluated for appointment of counsel. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. This hearing will be held in person.  Status conference scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Case calendared for a Pretrial Conference on 4-25-2022 at 8:30am. However, the court will not be in session at 8:30am and ordered matter to be scheduled at a later time.
New time confirmee with defendant via telephone. Zoom information provided. Pretrial Conference scheduled 4-25-2022 at 10:30am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ES.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Torrey Jermaile Lee in court.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 19 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Torrey Jermaile Lee not in court.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/8/22 @ 2p
